message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with designing a hardware architecture for sparse coding of visual stimuli using memristive crossbars and leaky integrate-and-fire neurons. This falls under the domain of neuromorphic computing, which is typically categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the paper specifically focuses on visual stimuli, which suggests a connection to computer vision, falling under cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The use of memristive crossbars and CMOS designs suggests a connection to electronic devices and circuits, which could fall under cs.ET (Emerging Technologies). The paper also proposes a new algorithm for sparse coding, which could fall under cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) or cs.LG (Machine Learning).
